com.github.essobedo.appma.spi

Interface Manageable


  • public interface Manageable
    Defines an application that can be managed by the ApplicationManager.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Nicolas Filotto (nicolas.filotto@gmail.com)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean accept(String... arguments)
      Indicates whether the application can handle the specified arguments.
      void destroy()
      Destroys the application.
      javafx.scene.image.Image icon()
      Gives the icon to use when launching the application.
      javafx.scene.Scene init(ApplicationManager manager, String... arguments)
      Initializes the application.
      boolean isJavaFX()
      Indicates whether the application is a Java FX application.
      String name()
      Gives the name of the application.
      String title()
      Gives the title of the window to use when launching the application.
      String version()
      Gives the identifier of the version of the application.

    • Method Detail

      • name

        String name()
        Gives the name of the application.
        Returns:
        the name of the application

      • version

        String version()
        Gives the identifier of the version of the application.
        Returns:
        the identifier of the version of the application.

      • title

        String title()
        Gives the title of the window to use when launching the application. This is only needed in case the application is a Java FX application.
        Returns:
        the title of the window to use when launching the application.

      • icon

        javafx.scene.image.Image icon()
        Gives the icon to use when launching the application. This is only needed in case the application is a Java FX application.
        Returns:
        the icon to use when launching the application.

      • accept

        boolean accept(String... arguments)
        Indicates whether the application can handle the specified arguments.
        Parameters:
        arguments - the arguments to check.
        Returns:
        true if the application can handle the specified arguments, false otherwise.

      • isJavaFX

        boolean isJavaFX()
        Indicates whether the application is a Java FX application.
        Returns:
        true if the application is a Java FX application, false otherwise.

      • init

        javafx.scene.Scene init(ApplicationManager manager,
                        String... arguments)
                 throws ApplicationException
        Initializes the application.
        Parameters:
        manager - the application manager allowing to interact with it.
        arguments - the arguments to use to initialize the application.
        Returns:
        a Scene corresponding to the initialized application if it is a Java FX application or null otherwise.
        Throws:
        ApplicationException - if the application could not be initialized.

      • destroy

        void destroy()
      throws ApplicationException
        Destroys the application.
        Throws:
        ApplicationException - if the application could not be destroyed.
